definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

sentences.english: He clapped his hat on angrily and walked out.
sentences.chinese: 他氣沖沖地急忙戴上帽子走出去了。

sentences.english: He stormed out of the room .
sentences.chinese: 他氣沖沖地走出了房間。

sentences.english: The purple wreath annoys dull blunt the ground stand get up.
sentences.chinese: 紫環氣沖沖地站了起來。

sentences.english: But I didn ‘t say anything and stormed off.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我嘴裏什麼都沒說，氣沖沖地走了。

sentences.english: The person promptly muttered something about blasts and me, then she walked away in a huff.
sentences.chinese: 這人立即衝我咆哮，然後氣沖沖地走了。

sentences.english: But I didn＇t say anything and stormed off8.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我嘴裏什麼都沒說，氣沖沖地走了。

sentences.english: She fling the papers on the desk and leave angrily.
sentences.chinese: 她把文件往桌子上一摔便氣沖沖地走了。

definition: to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
to whisper to one another's ear
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
